amendments.context: Calls upon Member States to enhance cooperation on climate-related security risks, including information sharing and capacity building.
amendments.text: including through the establishment of regional climate security coordination mechanisms
amendments.reason: Clarifies the means through which cooperation may be implemented.

amendments.context: Requests the Secretary-General to report annually on the impacts of climate change on international peace and security.
amendments.text: Requests the Secretary-General to report biennially on the impacts of climate change on international peace and security, with special attention to fragile and conflict-affected states.
amendments.reason: Adjusts reporting frequency to balance administrative capacity with substantive oversight.

amendments.context: Encourages the integration of climate risk assessments into peacekeeping mandates.
amendments.reason: The clause exceeds the Security Council’s mandate and may interfere with national sovereignty.

amendments.text: Promotes interoperable open data standards, with due regard for data privacy and sovereignty concerns.
amendments.reason: Adds necessary qualifiers for broader acceptance.

amendments.text: Establishes a rapid deployment fund of $50 million for peacekeeping operations in Sub-Saharan Africa.
amendments.reason: Provides necessary financial mechanisms for effective regional peacekeeping.
hope UK can accept as friendly amendment
